org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.util.date
Class FastChronoDate

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.util.date.ChronoDate
      org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.util.date.FastChronoDate

public class FastChronoDate
extends ChronoDate

Date class that implements its own date and time calculations, and therefore does not rely on the Java (in hosted mode) or Javascript (in browser mode) Date class.

Author:
chad takahashi

Constructor Summary
FastChronoDate(double timestamp)
          Constructs a new date object initialized to the specified timestamp.
FastChronoDate(int year, int month, int day)
          Constructs a new date object initialized to 0 hours, 0 minutes, 0 seconds, and 0 ms for the specified year, month and day.

Method Detail

add

public void add(TimeUnit timeUnit,
                int numUnits)
Description copied from class: ChronoDate
Adds the specified number of time units to this date. Implementations of this method are expected to handle "rollover" scenarios, where adding numUnits to this date would cause the next largest time unit to increment.

Specified by:
add in class ChronoDate

set

public DateFieldSetter set()
Description copied from class: ChronoDate
Sets the constituent components of this date via method chaining. For example, to set the date to 'January 19th, 1956': 
 myDate.set().year(1956).month(0).day(19).done();
Don't forget to call DateFieldSetter.done()! Otherwise the date modifications will not take effect.

Specified by:
set in class ChronoDate

set

public void set(TimeUnit timeUnit,
                int value)
Description copied from class: ChronoDate
Sets the specified date field to the specified value.

NOTE: If you need to set more than 1 date field, use ChronoDate.set() instead. This method defers date field validation until the DateFieldSetter.done() method is called.

Specified by:
set in class ChronoDate

setTime

public void setTime(double timeInMs)

truncate

public ChronoDate truncate(TimeUnit truncatePoint)
Description copied from class: ChronoDate
Truncates this date up to the specified time unit. For example, if myDate = '1987-Mar-12 14:30:59', then truncate(myDate, TimeUnit.MONTH) will truncate this date up to the month resulting in the date '1987-Mar-01 00:00:00'.

Specified by:
truncate in class ChronoDate
